HyperTIES Browser - The Space Telescope in Orbit

The Space Telescope in Orbit

The Hubble Space Telescope is a large optical telescope in orbit around Earth, designed to observe the universe without atmospheric interference.

The Space Telescope represents one of humanity's most ambitious scientific instruments. Launched into orbit to escape Earth's atmosphere, it provides unprecedented views of the cosmos.

WFPC
FOC
FOS
HRS
HSP

Click on any instrument in the diagram above to learn more about its capabilities. The telescope carries five main scientific instruments:

  • WFPC - Wide Field/Planetary Camera
  • FOC - Faint Object Camera
  • FOS - Faint Object Spectrograph
  • HRS - High Resolution Spectrograph
  • HSP - High Speed Photometer
